### Risk Neutral Parties & Unlimited Liability

- RN assumptions: $V(x) = x$, $u(w) = w$
- Principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a,w_i} && &p(a)\cdot (1-w_1) + \big(1-p(a)\big)\cdot (0-w_0) \\
(PC) && &p(a)\cdot w_1 + \big(1-p(a)\big)\cdot w_0 - a\geq 0 \\
(IC) && &a\in\max_{\hat{a}} \ p(\hat{a})\cdot w_1 + \big(1-p(\hat{a})\big)\cdot w_0 - \hat{a} \end{aligned}$$
Let (PC) be binding,
$$\begin{aligned}p(a)\cdot w_1 + \big(1-p(a)\big)\cdot w_0 - a &= 0 \\
p(a)\cdot (-w_1) + \big(1-p(a)\big)\cdot (-w_0) &= -a \\
p(a)\cdot (1-w_1) + \big(1-p(a)\big)\cdot (-w_0) &= p(a)-a\end{aligned}$$
plug into principal's problem
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a} && p(a)-a &\phantom{\ggg} \\
FOC && p'(a) - 1 &\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& p'(a^*) &= 1\end{aligned}$$
Plug into (IC) (agent's maximization problem) gives:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a} && p(a)\cdot w_1 + \big(1-p(a)\big)\cdot w_0 &- a \\
FOC && p'(a^*)\cdot ( w_1 -w_0)-1 &\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& w_1 -w_0 &= 1 \end{aligned}$$
plug into (PC)
$$\begin{aligned}p(a^*)\cdot (w_0+1) + \big(1-p(a^*)\big)\cdot w_0 &= a^* \\
p(a^*) + w_0 &= a^* \\
\underbrace{p(a^*) - a^*}_{\text{Social surplus}} &= -w_0 \end{aligned}$$
$\implies$ franchise contract with fee $w_0$ obtains first best soluition  
$a^* = a^{FB}$

### Risk Neutral Parties & Limited Liability

- RN assumptions: $V(x) = x$, $u(w) = w$
- LL assumptions: $w_1\geq w_0\geq 0\implies w_0=0$
- Principal's problem becomes: 
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a,w_1} && &p(a)(1-w_1) \\
(PC) && &p(a)\cdot w_1 - a\geq 0 \\
(IC) && &a\in\text{argmax}_{\hat{a}} \ p(\hat{a})\cdot w_1 - \hat{a} \end{aligned}$$
(PC) is slack under (IC)  
Solving (IC) (agent's maximization problem):
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a} && p(a)\cdot w_1 &- a \\
FOC && p'(a^*)\cdot w_1 -1 &\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& p'(a^*)\cdot w_1 &= 1 \\
&& w_1 &= \frac{1}{p'(a^*)}\end{aligned}$$
Plugging into principal's problem gives unconstrained problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a} && p(a)\big(1-\frac{1}{p'(a)}\big)& \\
FOC && p'(a^{**}) - \frac{\big(p'(a^{**})\big)^2 - p''(a^{**})\cdot p(a^{**})}{\big(p'(a^{**})\big)^2} &\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& p'(a^{**}) = 1-\frac{p''(a^{**})\cdot p(a^{**})}{\big(p'(a^{**})\big)^2} &< 1\end{aligned}$$
Therefore, $a^{**} < a^{FB}$ 

## Moral Hazard: Constant Absolute Risk Aversion (CARA)

CT 4.2

- Principal's utility: (RN) $V(x) = x$
- Agent's utility: (RA) $$u(w,a) = -\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(w-g(a)\big)\Big)$$
    - Cost of effort: $g(a) = \frac{c}{2}a^2$
    - Risk aversion coefficient: $r=-\frac{u''}{u'}$
    - Effort: $a$
    - Performance: $q=a+ε$  
    $ε\sim\mathcal{N}(0,σ^2)\implies q\sim\mathcal{N}(a,σ^2)$
    - pdf of $q$: $f(q|a)$
    - Likelihood ratio:
    $$\begin{aligned}f(q|a) &= \frac{1}{\sqrt{2πσ}}\cdot\exp\Big(- \frac{(q-a)^2}{2σ^2}\Big)\\
    \frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} &= \frac{q-a}{σ^2} \\
    &\in (-\infty, \infty)\end{aligned}$$

### Linear Contract

- Contract: $$w = β + αq$$
    - Efficient incentive (all risk on agent): $α = 1$
    - Efficient risk-sharing (all risk on principal, flat wage): $α = 0$
- Principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a, α,β} && &\phantom{\ggg}E[ q-w] \\
&& &= E\big[q - (β + αq) \big] \\
&& &= E\big[(1-α)q - β\big] \\
&& &= a(1-α) - β \\
(PC) && &E\bigg[-\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αq - g(a)\big)\Big) \bigg]\geq -\exp(-r\cdot 0) \\
(IC) && &a\in\text{argmax}_{\hat{a}} \ E\bigg[-\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αq - g(\hat{a})\big)\Big) \bigg]\end{aligned}$$
Solving (IC) (agent's maximization problem) gives
$$\begin{aligned}\max_a && &\phantom{\ggg}E\bigg[-\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αq - g(a)\big)\Big) \bigg] \\
&& &= -E\bigg[\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αq - g(a)\big)\Big)\bigg] \\
&& &= -E\bigg[\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + rαa + αε - g(a)\big)\Big)\bigg] \\
&& &= -E\big[\exp(-r\cdot αε)\big]\cdot\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αa - g(a)\big)\Big) \\
&& &= -\exp\Big(\frac{r^2α^2σ^2}{2}\Big)\cdot\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αa - g(a)\big)\Big) \\
&& &= -\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(\underbrace{\frac{-rα^2σ^2}{2} - g(a) +β +αa}_{\text{Certainty equivalent compensation}}\big)\Big) \end{aligned}$$
since $-\exp(\cdot)$ is decreasing, let 
$$\begin{aligned}\hat{w}(a) &= \frac{-rα^2σ^2}{2}- g(a) +β +αa  \\
\hat{w}'(a) &= -g'(a) + α \\
&=-\frac{1}{2}\cdot 2ac + α \overset{!}{=} 0 \\
a^* &= \frac{α}{c} \end{aligned}$$
let (PC) be binding: 
$$\begin{aligned}E\bigg[-\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(β + αq - g(a)\big)\Big) \bigg]&= -\exp(-r\cdot 0) \\
-\exp\Big(-r\cdot\big(\frac{-rα^2σ^2}{2} - g(a) +β +αa\big)\Big) &= -\exp(-r\cdot 0) \\
-r\cdot\big(\frac{-rα^2σ^2}{2} - g(a) +β +αa\big) &= -r\cdot 0 \\
\frac{-rα^2σ^2}{2} - g(a)+β +αa &= 0 \\
\frac{-rα^2σ^2 - a^2c}{2} +αa &= -β \end{aligned}$$
plug back into principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a, α} && &\phantom{\ggg}a(1-α) - β\\
&& &= a(1-α) + \frac{-rα^2σ^2 - a^2c}{2} +αa \\
&& &= a + \frac{-rα^2σ^2 - a^2c}{2} \end{aligned}$$
plug in $a^*$ gives unconstrained problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{α} && &\phantom{\ggg}\frac{α}{c} + \frac{-rα^2σ^2 - (\frac{α}{c})^2c}{2} \\
&& &=\frac{α}{c} - \frac{α^2}{2c} - \frac{rα^2σ^2}{2} \\
FOC && &\frac{1}{c} - 2\cdot\frac{α}{2c} - 2\cdot\frac{rασ^2}{2}\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& &α^* = \frac{1}{1+crσ^2} < 1\end{aligned}$$
$\implies$ less than efficient incentive
- When effort is observable ($q=a$),  
principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a, α,β} && &\phantom{\ggg} a - (β + αa) \\
&& &= (1-α)a - β \\
(PC) && &\frac{-rα^2 - a^2c}{2}+β +αa = 0\end{aligned}$$
plug in
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{a, α} && &\phantom{\ggg} (1-α)a + \frac{-rα^2 - a^2c}{2} +αa \\
&& &= a + \frac{-rα^2 - a^2c}{2} \\
FOC && &\frac{\partial}{\partial a} = 1 - 2\cdot \frac{ca}{2}\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& &a^{**} = \frac{1}{c} \\
&& &\frac{\partial}{\partial α} = -2\cdot\frac{rα}{2}\overset{!}{=} 0 \\
&& &α^{**} = 0\end{aligned}$$
$\implies$ efficient risk-sharing

> PS4.Q2  
> Consider the following contracting problem between a risk neutral principal and a risk averse agent.  
> The agent has utility function 
> $$u(w,a) = -\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( w - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)$$
> where $w$ is income, $a$ is effort, $ρ>0$ is the coefficient of absolute risk aversion and $c > 0$ is a cost parameter.  
> Suppose the agent's effort affects output in periods 1, 2 according to
> $$\begin{aligned}q_1 &= a + ε_{q_1} \\ q_2 &= a + ε_{q_2} \end{aligned}$$
> where $ε_{q_i}\overset{iid}{\sim}\mathcal{N}(0,σ_q^2)$.  
> The agent retires at the end of period one, so that his pay cannot be made contingent directly on $q_2$.  
> However, the agent's pay can depend on the stock price:
> $P = 2a + ε_P$ 
> where $ε_{P}\sim\mathcal{N}(0,σ_P^2)$.  
> 
> 1. Derive the optimal compensation contract within the class of linear compensation schemes of the form:
> $$w = α+ f\cdot q_1 + s\cdot P$$
> To do this, you need to compute the variance of a linear combination of normally distributed random variables.  
> Note that $ε_P$ and $ε_{q_i}$ need not be independent.  
> 2. Discuss how the solution depends on the correlation between the noise terms.  
> How does the optimal level of $f$ compare to the optimal level of $s$ if the noise terms are independent?

1. Optimal linear contract  
$$\begin{aligned}w &= α+ f\cdot q_1 + s\cdot P\\
E[w] &= E\big[α + f\cdot (a + ε_{q_1}) + s\cdot (2a + ε_P)\big] \\
&= α + fa + 2sa \\
Var(w) &= E\big[(w - E[w])^2\big] \\
&= E\big[(fε_{q_1} + sε_P)^2\big] \\
&= f^2σ_{q_1}^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2fs\underbrace{σ_{qP}}_{Corr(qP)}\end{aligned}$$
(IC): (Certainty equivalent of agent):
$$\hat{w} = -\exp\Big( -ρ\big(- \frac{ρ}{2}(f^2σ_{q_1}^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2fsσ_{qP}) + (α + fa + 2sa) - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\Big)$$
$a^*$ solves maximizing (IC):
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{\hat{a}} && &-ρ\big(α + fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\\
&& &a^* = \frac{f+2s}{c}\end{aligned}$$
Let (PC) be binding, substitude $a^*$ gives
$$\begin{aligned}f^* &= \frac{σ^2_P - 2σ_{qP}}{2σ^2_q + \frac{1}{2}σ^2_P + ρc(σ^2_Pσ^2_q - σ^2_{qP})} \\
s^* &= \frac{2σ^2_q - σ_{qP}}{2σ^2_q + \frac{1}{2}σ^2_P + ρc(σ^2_Pσ^2_q - σ^2_{qP})} \end{aligned}$$
1. My solution  
Principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{α,f,s} && &\phantom{\ggg} E[q_1 + q_2 - w] \\
&& &= E\big[(a + ε_{q_1}) + (a + ε_{q_2}) - (α+ f\cdot q_1 + s\cdot P)\big] \\
&& &= E\big[ 2a + ε_{q_1} + ε_{q_2} - α - f\cdot (a + ε_{q_1}) - s\cdot (2a + ε_P)\big] \\
&& &= E\big[ 2a + ε_{q_1} + ε_{q_2} - α - fa - fε_{q_1} - 2sa - sε_P\big] \\
&& &= E\big[ a(2 - f - 2s)- α + ε_{q_1}(1-f) + ε_{q_2} - sε_P\big] \\
&& &= a(2 - f - 2s)- α \end{aligned}$$
s.t. 
$$\begin{aligned}(PC) && &E\Big[ -\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( w - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)\Big] \geq -\exp(-ρ\cdot 0) \\
(IC) && &a\in\text{argmax}_{\hat{a}} \ E\Big[ -\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( w - \frac{1}{2}c\hat{a}^2 \big)\Big)\Big] \end{aligned}$$
(IC) gives agent's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_a && &\phantom{\ggg}E\Big[ -\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( w - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)\Big] \\
&& &= -E\Big[\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( (α+ f\cdot q_1 + s\cdot P) - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)\Big] \\
&& &= -E\Big[\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( α+ f\cdot (a + ε_{q_1}) + s\cdot (2a + ε_P) - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)\Big] \\
&& &= -E\Big[\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( α+ fa + fε_{q_1} + 2sa + sε_P - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)\Big] \\
&& &= -E\big[\exp\big(-ρ\cdot(fε_{q_1} + sε_P)\big)\big]\cdot\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big(α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\Big)\end{aligned}$$
since $ε_{q_i}\overset{iid}{\sim}\mathcal{N}(0,σ_q^2)$, $ε_{P}\sim\mathcal{N}(0,σ_P^2)$,  
$\implies fε_{q_i}\overset{iid}{\sim}\mathcal{N}(0,f^2σ_q^2)$, $sε_{P}\sim\mathcal{N}(0,s^2σ_P^2)$,  
$fε_{q_1} + sε_P\sim \mathcal{N}(0,f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)$, where $r = Corr(fε_{q_1} , sε_P)$  
therefore,
$$\begin{aligned}&\phantom{\ggg}-E\big[\exp\big(-ρ\cdot(fε_{q_1} + sε_P)\big)\big]\cdot\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big(α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\Big)\\
&= -\exp\big(\frac{ρ^2\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2}\big)\cdot\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big(α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\Big)\\
&= -\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big(\frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} + α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\Big)\end{aligned}$$
since $-\exp(\cdot)$ is decreasing, let 
$$\begin{aligned}\hat{w}(a) &= \frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} + α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \\
\hat{w}'(a) &= f + 2s - ca \overset{!}{=} 0 \\
a^* &= \frac{f+2s}{c}\end{aligned}$$
Let (PC) be binding,
$$\begin{aligned}E\Big[ -\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big( w - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \big)\Big)\Big] &= -\exp(-ρ\cdot 0) \\
-\exp\Big(-ρ\cdot\big(\frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} + α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2\big)\Big) &= -\exp(-ρ\cdot 0) \\
\frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} + α+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 &= 0 \\
\frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} + fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 &= -α \end{aligned}$$
plug $a^*,α$ into principal's problem gives unconstrained maximization problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{f,s} && &\phantom{\ggg}a(2 - f - 2s)- α \\
&& &= a(2 - f - 2s) + \frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} \\
&& &\phantom{\ggg}+ fa + 2sa - \frac{1}{2}ca^2 \\
&& &= \frac{f+2s}{c}(2 - f - 2s) + \frac{-ρ\cdot(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)}{2} \\
&& &\phantom{\ggg}+ \frac{(f+2s)^2}{c} - \frac{c}{2}\cdot\big(\frac{f+2s}{c}\big)^2 \\
&& &= \frac{1}{c}\big(2-\frac{1}{2}f - s\big)(f+2s) - \frac{ρ}{2}(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)\\
&& &= \frac{1}{c}\big(2f -\frac{1}{2}f^2 - 2sf + 4s - 2s^2\big) - \frac{ρ}{2}(f^2σ_q^2 + s^2σ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qsσ_P)\end{aligned}$$
FOC gives
$$\begin{aligned}\frac{\partial}{\partial f}&= \frac{1}{c}(2 - f - 2s) - \frac{ρ}{2}(2fσ_q^2 + 2rσ_qsσ_P) \overset{!}{=}0 \\
f &= \frac{4 - 4s - 2crsρσ_qσ_P}{2 + 2cρσ_q^2} \\
\frac{\partial}{\partial s}&= \frac{1}{c}(-2f + 4 - 4s) - \frac{ρ}{2}(2sσ_P^2 + 2rfσ_qσ_P)\overset{!}{=}0 \\
f &= \frac{8-8s-2csρσ_P^2}{4+2rcρσ_qσ_P}\\
s &= \frac{-2rσ_qσ_P + 4σ_q^2}{r(-4σ_qσ_P - cρσ_q^2σ_P^2)+ σ_P^2 + 4σ_q^2 + cρσ_q^2σ_P^2} \end{aligned}$$
2. When noises are independent, and $σ^2_q = σ^2_P$,
$\implies s^* = 2f^*$  
The ratio of diversification is the same as in the ratio of effort in output and stock price.

### Step Contract

CT 4.3  
[Mirrlees (1975)](https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/2566946.pdf)  
[Monotone likelihood ratio \- Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monotone_likelihood_ratio)

- Assumptions
    - Monotone likelihood ratio property (MLRP)
    $$\begin{aligned}\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} &= \frac{q-a}{σ^2} \\
    \frac{\partial}{\partial q}\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} &\geq 0 \end{aligned}$$
    - $\lim_{q\to -\infty}\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} = -\infty$
- Step contract: $w=\begin{cases}w^* & q\geq\underline{q} \\ K & q<\underline{q} \end{cases}$ where $K$ is very small
- When implementing $a=a^*$, Principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{K, w^*} && &E[q - w] \\
(PC) && &\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}u(K)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq - g(a^*) \\
&& &\geq\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq \\
(IC) && &a^*\in\text{argmax}_{\hat{a}} \ \int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}u(K)\cdot f(q|a)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a)\, dq - g(a)\end{aligned}$$
- Why not: ?? why (PC)??
$$\begin{aligned}\text{Proposed }(PC) && &\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}u(K)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq - g(a^*) \\
&& &\geq \int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}u(K)\cdot f(q|0)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|0)\, dq - g(0) \end{aligned}$$
- To induce first best effort level $a^*$,  
set $K$ be s.t. (IC) (agent's maximization problem):
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{\hat{a}} && &\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}u(K)\cdot f(q|a)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a)\, dq - g(a) \\
FOC && &\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}u(K)\cdot f_a(q|a^*)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f_a(q|a^*)\, dq \overset{!}{=} g'(a^*) \end{aligned}$$
Let (PC) be binding, it is violated by
$$\begin{aligned}&\phantom{\ggg}\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq \\
&\phantom{\ggg} - \Big[ \int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}} u(K)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq + \int_{\underline{q}}^{\infty} u(w^*)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq \Big] \\
&=\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}\big( u(w^*) - u(K) \big)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq >0 \\
&\overset{?}{\to} 0\end{aligned}$$
By assumption, for any $M$, exists some $\underline{q}$ s.t. for all $q<\underline{q}$, 
$$\begin{aligned}\frac{\partial}{\partial q}\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} &\geq 0 \\
\lim_{q\to -\infty}\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} &= -\infty \\
\implies \frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} &< -M \\
f(q|a) &< -\frac{1}{M}\cdot f_a(q|a) \\
\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}\big( u(w^*) - u(K) \big)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq &< -\frac{1}{M}\cdot \int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}\big( u(w^*) - u(K) \big)\cdot f_a(q|a^*)\, dq \\
&< -\frac{1}{M}\cdot\Big( \int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}} u(w^*)\cdot f_a(q|a^*)\, dq - g'(a^*)\Big) \end{aligned}$$
choose $M$ large enough, then we have 
$$\int_{-\infty}^{\underline{q}}\big( u(w^*) - u(K) \big)\cdot f(q|a^*)\, dq >0 \overset{?}{\to} 0$$


### First Order Approach

CT 4.4  
[Ian Jewitt (1988)](https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/1911363.pdf)  
[Stochastic dominance \- Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stochastic_dominance)

- Principal's utility (RA): $V(q-w)$
    - $V'>0$, $V''<0$
- Agent's utility (RA): $u(w) - g(a)$
    - $u'>0$, $u''<0$
    - $g'>0$, $g''>0$
    - Output: $q\in[\underline{q},\bar{q}]$
    - cdf: $F(q|a)$
    - pdf: $f(q|a)$
    - Non-moving support: $F(\bar{q}|a) = 1$, $F(\underline{q}|a) = 0$ are independent with $a$  
    $\implies F_a(q|a)\Big|_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} = 0$
- Assumptions
    - Convexity of the distribution function condition (CDFC): $$F_{aa}(q|a)\geq 0$$
    - Monotone likelihood ratio property (MLRP) $$\frac{\partial}{\partial q}\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)} \geq 0$$
    - First order stochastic dominance (FOSD): $$\hat{a}>a\implies F(q|\hat{a})\leq F(q|a)$$
    ![CT Figure 4.1](/post-img/notes-contract--FOSD.png){width=537px}
    - MLRP $\implies$ FOSD
- Principal's problem:
$$\begin{aligned}\max_{w(q),a} && &\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}}V\big(q-w(q)\big)\cdot f(q|a)\, dq \\
(PC) && &\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u\big(w(q)\big)\cdot f(q|a)\, dq - g(a) \geq \bar{u} =0 \\ 
(IC) && &a^*\in\text{argmax}_{\hat{a}} \ \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u\big(w(q)\big)\cdot f(q|\hat{a})\, dq - g(\hat{a}) \end{aligned}$$
Solving (IC) (agent's maximization problem) gives
$$\begin{aligned}FOC && &\phantom{\ggg}\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u\big(w(q)\big) \cdot f_a(q|a)\, dq \overset{!}{=} g'(a) \end{aligned}$$
$$\begin{aligned}&\phantom{\ggg}\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u\big(w(q)\big) \cdot f_a(q|a)\, dq \\
&= \underbrace{u\big(w(q)\big) \cdot F_a(q|a)}_{\text{Non-moving support}}\Big|_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} - \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u'\big(w(q)\big)\cdot w'(q) \cdot F_a(q|a)\, dq \\
&= (0 -0) - \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u'\big(w(q)\big)\cdot w'(q) \cdot \underbrace{F_a(q|a)}_{FOSD:\leq 0}\, dq \\
&= - \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} u'\big(w(q)\big)\cdot w'(q) \cdot F_a(q|a)\, dq \end{aligned}$$
1. Lagrangian
$$\begin{aligned}\mathcal{L} = \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}}\Big( V\big(q-w(q)\big)\cdot f(q|a) + λ\big(\underbrace{u(w(q))\cdot f(q|a) - g(a)}_{(PC)}\big) \\
+μ\big(\underbrace{u(w(q))\cdot f_a(q|a) - g'(a)}_{(IC)}\big) \Big)\, dq \end{aligned}$$
2. Show that $μ>0$
    - FOC to Lagrangian: 
    $$\begin{aligned}\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial a}\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}}\Big(V\big(q-w(q)\big)\cdot f_a(q|a) + λ\big(u(w(q))\cdot f_a(q|a) -g'(a)\big)& \\
    +μ\big(u(w(q))\cdot f_{aa}(q|a) -g''(a)\big)\Big)\, dq &= 0 \end{aligned}$$
    Let $w^{FB}(q)$ denote first-best wage scheme (PC only),
    $$\begin{aligned}V'\big(q -w^{FB}(q) \big) &= λ\cdot u'\big(w^{FB}(q)\big) \\
    \frac{V'\big(q -w^{FB}(q) \big)}{u'\big(w^{FB}(q)\big)} &= λ \end{aligned}$$
    compare to second best:
    $$\frac{V'\big(q -w(q) \big)}{u'\big(w(q)\big)} = λ + μ\cdot\frac{f_a(q|a)}{f(q|a)}$$
    FSOC $μ\leq 0$  
    $\implies w(q)\leq w^{FB}(q)$ for $q$ s.t. $f_a(q|a)>0$  
    and $w(q)\geq w^{FB}(q)$ for $q$ s.t. $f_a(q|a)<0$  
    therefore
    $$\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} V\big(q-w(q)\big)\cdot f_a(q|a)\, dq \geq \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} V\big(q-w^{FB}(q)\big)\cdot f_a(q|a)\, dq$$
    However, using integration by parts,
    $$\begin{aligned}&\phantom{\ggg}\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} V\big(q-w^{FB}(q)\big)\cdot f_a(q|a)\, dq \\
    &= \underbrace{V\big(q-w^{FB}(q)\big)\cdot F_a(q|a)}_{\text{Non-moving support}}\Big|_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} - \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}}V'\big(q-w^{FB}(q)\big)\cdot\big(1-w^{FB\prime}(q)\big)\cdot F_a(q|a)\, dq \\
    &= - \int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}}V'\big(q-w^{FB}(q)\big)\cdot\big(1-w^{FB\prime}(q)\big)\cdot F_a(q|a)\, dq\end{aligned}$$
    Since $\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial a}$ gives
    $$\begin{aligned}\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} V\big(q-w(q)\big)\cdot f_a(q|a) + μ\cdot u\big(w(q)\big)\cdot f_{aa}(a|a) \, dq - g''(a) = 0 \\
    \underbrace{\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}} V\big(q-w(q)\big)\cdot f_a(q|a)\, dq}_{>0} = -μ\cdot\underbrace{\int_{\underline{q}}^{\bar{q}}u\big(w(q)\big)\cdot f_{aa}(a|a)\, dq - g''(a)}_{<0} \end{aligned}$$
    $\implies μ>0$ 
3. Show MLRP implies $w'(q)\geq 0$
4. Show MLRP & CDFC $\implies$ FOC applies
